org.jpws.front

Class PolicyDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.jpws.front.util.ButtonBarDialog
                • org.jpws.front.PolicyDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, ActivitySource

    public class PolicyDialog
extends ButtonBarDialog
implements ActivitySource
    Creates a password policy dialog box and handles user interaction with it. The constructed instance does not auto-display. show() or setVisible() must be called separately.
    Since:
    0-5-0 subclass of ButtonBarDialog
    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolicyDialog

        public PolicyDialog(java.awt.Window owner,
                    org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrasePolicy policy,
                    int modus)
             throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Constructor for a modal Policy dialog.
        Parameters:
        owner - Window the ancestor Window component
        policy - password policy to be edited
        modus - policy validity type (for title only); 0 = global, 1 = record, 2 = generator, 3 = file
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes and destroys this dialog.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class ButtonBarDialog

      • getEditedPolicy

        public org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrasePolicy getEditedPolicy()
        Returns the password policy edited during the dialogue. This is not guaranteed to be a valid policy! It is a valid policy only if isOkPressed() returns true (and the initial policy was also a valid policy).
        Returns:
        policy

      • performed

        public static PolicyDialog performed(java.awt.Component owner,
                                     ActivityListener listener,
                                     org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrasePolicy policy,
                                     int modus)
        Performs a modal Policy dialog with given parameters on the EDT and returns the dialog when it is terminated. The given policy is not modified; the edited version must be fetched by getEditedPolicy() method on the returned dialog.
        Parameters:
        owner - Component dialog parent component
        listener - ActivityListener may be null
        policy - PwsPassphrasePolicy to be edited
        modus - int policy validity type (for dialog title); 0 = global, 1 = record, 2 = generator, 3 = file
        Returns:
        PolicyDialog
